snippet: The closing of a news agency reflects President Vladimir Putin’s increasingly pronounced view in which enemies at home and abroad plot against Russia.
abstract: Serge Schmemann Editorial Observer contends the closing of Russian RIA Novosti news agency during the Ukrainian crisis reflects Pres Vladimir Putin's increasingly pronounced view that enemies at home and abroad plot against Russia; warns closing agency will not alter the reality it reported, and will add to the resentment of people who are tired of being taken for fools.
lead_paragraph: The closing of a news agency reflects President Vladimir Putin’s increasingly pronounced view in which enemies at home and abroad plot against Russia.

headline.print_headline: The Kremlin, the Press and the Protesters: A Case Study of Rule by Paranoia
